Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; glaze firedred-brown; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; exterior: line at top of rim; below, painted decoration consisting of head of goat, to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3). 'AΠ' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 18)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 233, no. 126)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0173) (phase 2)
